N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2600.2 - Definitions

State Regulations

As used in this Chapter: (a) Commissioner shall mean the Commissioner
of the Division of Housing and Community Renewal. (b) Division or DHCR shall mean the New York

State Division of Housing and Community Renewal. (c) Immediate family shall mean, with
reference to an individual person, that person's parents, stepparents, spouse, brothers, stepbrothers, sisters, stepsisters, sons, stepsons, daughters and
stepdaughters; and the spouses of each. (d) Municipality shall mean any city, town or
village within the State with a population in excess of 20,000. (e) Neighborhood shall mean the identified
geographic boundaries within which the company shall carry out its proposed
activities. (f) Neighborhood
preservation company (NPC) or companyshall mean a corporation, organized under
the provisions of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, which has been engaged
primarily in one or more neighborhood preservation activities. (g) Neighborhood preservation activities or
activitiesshall mean activities engaged in by a neighborhood preservation
company within a geographically defined neighborhood of a municipality
designed: (1)
(i) to construct, maintain, preserve, repair, renovate, upgrade, improve, modernize, rehabilitate or otherwise prolong the
useful life, and to manage and coordinate the rehabilitation, of residential
dwelling accommodations within such neighborhood; (ii)
to restore abandoned and vacant as well
as occupied housing accommodations to habitable condition; (iii)
to demolish structurally unsound or
unsafe or otherwise unsightly or unhealthy structures which no longer serve or
can economically be made to serve a useful purpose consistent with stabilizing
or improving a neighborhood; (iv)
to seal and maintain vacant but structurally sound structures which are capable
of being rehabilitated at a future time and used for housing
purposes; (v) to acquire, where
appropriate, buildings which contain housing accommodations; (vi)
to facilitate the disposition of
buildings containing housing accommodations to individual occupants thereof, or
to cooperative groups whose members shall be occupants thereof; (vii)
to assist owners, occupants and tenants
of housing accommodations to obtain improvements in the physical conditions
thereof and in the safety, maintenance and management thereof; and
(viii)
to manage housing accommodations as
agents for the owners thereof or administrators or receivers appointed or
designated pursuant to any law of the State; (2)
to provide those ancillary services
necessary to support neighborhood preservation, including but not limited to
housing information and education, arson prevention, energy conservation; and
(3)
to accomplish similar
purposes and meet similar needs with respect to retail and service
establishments within such neighborhoods, in conjunction with and incidental to
a program of housing-related activities. (h) Persons of low income shall mean
individuals and families whose annual incomes do not exceed 90 percent of the
median annual income for all residents of the municipality within which they
reside. Notes
